objective: Design and help build a visionary, non-traditional developer portfolio that represents thinking, learning, and emergence rather than static content.

author_identity.name: Nasuhan Yunus Özkaya
author_identity.description: A developer whose work spans software engineering, data systems, visualization, and reflective writing, with a strong emphasis on systems thinking and learning through complexity.

previous_portfolio.note: An older, traditional portfolio using now-outdated patterns; serves as a contrast to the new experiential system-based approach.

core_idea.metaphor: A self-organizing mind map / living system
core_idea.description: The portfolio is not a website with pages. It is a dynamic system where chaos gradually organizes into meaning, representing how the developer thinks, learns, fails, and grows.

visual_behavior.initial_state: Pure entropy. Nodes float randomly with no labels or hierarchy.
visual_behavior.emergence: Over time and interaction, nodes cluster into conceptual regions without snapping or rigid layouts.

camera.rule: Camera never snaps, never follows mouse directly, always feels calm and observational

visual_behavior.depth: Subtle Z-depth and fog to suggest infinite space

nodes.meaning: Each node represents an idea, project, skill, thought, or experience.
nodes.behavior: Nodes move according to forces and interactions, not UI rules.

clusters.description: Conceptual regions (e.g. Systems, Data, Thoughts, Failure) that emerge naturally through physics-based attraction.
clusters.rule: Clusters are suggested, not hard-coded visually.

signal_node.name: Today's Signal
signal_node.description: A single, calm, authoritative node that represents daily wisdom from historical thinkers.

content.source: A curated list of ~300 short wisdom statements
content.rule: One deterministic message per day, same for all visitors

blogs_and_thoughts.description: Blog posts and essays sourced from the author's Medium writings and local Markdown files, represented as thought nodes.
sources: Medium articles by Nasuhan Yunus Özkaya
blogs_and_thoughts.behavior: Clicking a thought node opens contextual reading without breaking immersion.

projects.source: GitHub repositories belonging to the author
projects.description: Projects are represented as system nodes emphasizing intent, constraints, failure points, and outcomes rather than feature lists.

failure.description: Failure is explicitly represented as its own cluster.
visual_language: Outgoing connections toward later successful nodes

mouse.effect: Nearby nodes subtly bend toward cursor presence
mouse.rule: Mouse never directly controls or drags nodes

interaction_rules.learning_curve: Nothing is explained upfront. Meaning is discovered through observation and interaction.

physics_engine.responsibility: All node movement, attraction, repulsion, clustering, and emergence

rendering_engine.responsibility: All visuals, camera, lighting, depth, and animation

framework.responsibility: Composition, structure, data wiring, and content management (not animation)

technical_architecture.architecture_rule: D3 mutates data, Three.js reads positions every frame, React does not manage physics state.

design_constraints.color: Mostly monochrome, color only used to encode meaning
design_constraints.animations: No decorative animations; motion must communicate information
design_constraints.performance: Must scale to hundreds of nodes smoothly

message_to_viewer: This is how chaos becomes structure
This is how I learn and fail
This is how my mind organizes knowledge
end_goal.portfolio_signal: The developer understands systems, emergence, complexity, and reflection — not just tools.
